message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.GT, cs.NE 

The paper discusses the use of deep learning for reward design to improve Monte Carlo Tree Search in Atari games. This involves the use of convolutional neural networks (cs.CV) to automatically learn features from raw perception and adapt non-linear reward-bonus function parameters. The paper also mentions the use of policy-gradient methods (cs.AI) and variance-reducing gradient methods (cs.NE) to improve the performance of the algorithm. Finally, the paper discusses the application of the method to sequential decision-making problems (cs.GT) and the use of machine learning techniques to improve performance (cs.LG).
